instructions.description: Adds two registers and stores the result in the destination register.
Adds an immediate value to a register and stores the result in the destination register.
Adds a 12-bit signed immediate value to the lower 32 bits of a register, sign-extends the result, and stores it in the destination register.
Adds the lower 32 bits of two registers, sign-extends the result to 64 bits, and stores it in the destination register.
Performs a bitwise AND operation on two registers and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a bitwise AND operation between a register and an immediate value, storing the result in the destination register.
Adds an immediate offset to the current PC and stores the result in the destination register.
Branches to the target if the registers are equal.
Branches to the target label if the value in the first register is greater than or equal to the value in the second register (signed comparison).
Branches to the target label if the value in the first register is greater than or equal to the value in the second register (unsigned comparison).
Branches to the target if the first register is less than the second.
Branches to the target address (offset) if the value in the first register is less than the value in the second register (unsigned comparison). The assembler resolves symbolic labels into offsets.
Branches to the target if the registers are not equal.
Performs a read-modify-write operation on the CSR. Clears bits in the CSR as specified by the source register and writes the previous CSR value to the destination register.
Performs a read-modify-write operation on the CSR. Clears bits in the CSR as specified by the immediate value and writes the previous CSR value to the destination register.
Performs a read-modify-write operation on the CSR. Sets bits in the CSR as specified by the source register and writes the previous CSR value to the destination register.
Performs a read-modify-write operation on the CSR. Sets bits in the CSR as specified by the immediate value and writes the previous CSR value to the destination register.
Reads the CSR and writes a new value to it.
Writes an immediate value directly to the CSR and writes the previous CSR value to the destination register.
Performs signed integer division of the first source register by the second source register and stores the quotient in the destination register. Division by zero results in an undefined value.
Performs unsigned integer division of the first source register by the second source register and stores the quotient in the destination register. Division by zero results in an undefined value.

Performs unsigned integer division of the lower 32 bits of the first source register by the second source register and stores the quotient in the lower 32 bits of the destination register, with the result sign-extended to 64 bits.

Performs signed integer division of the lower 32 bits of the first source register by the second source register and stores the quotient in the lower 32 bits of the destination register, with the result sign-extended to 64 bits.
Generates a system call to invoke services provided by the execution environment. The behavior depends on the value in the a7 register (or equivalent, depending on the calling convention).
Breakpoint for debugging.
Ensures ordering of memory operations as specified by the pred and succ fields. Pred defines prior memory operations, and succ defines subsequent memory operations affected by the fence.
Flushes the instruction cache to ensure that all subsequent instruction fetches reflect memory updates made by prior stores.
Jumps to the address specified by the offset and stores the address of the next instruction (PC + 4) in the destination register.

Jumps to the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, and stores the address of the next instruction (PC + 4) in the destination register. The least significant bit of the computed address is cleared.
Loads an 8-bit byte from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, sign-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a byte from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, zero-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a double word (64 bits) from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a half word (16 bits) from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, sign-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a half word (16 bits) from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, zero-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a 20-bit immediate into the upper 20 bits of the destination register, with the lower 12 bits set to zero.
Loads a word (32 bits) from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, sign-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Loads a word (32 bits) from memory at the address computed by adding the offset to the value in the base register, zero-extends it, and stores it in the destination register.
Multiplies the values in the two source registers and stores the lower bits of the result in the destination register.
Multiplies the values in the two source registers as signed integers and stores the upper bits of the result in the destination register.
Multiplies the first source register as a signed integer and the second source register as an unsigned integer. The upper bits of the result are stored in the destination register.
Multiplies the values in the two source registers as unsigned integers and stores the upper bits of the result in the destination register.
Multiplies the lower 32 bits of the two source registers as signed integers and stores the lower 32 bits of the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.
Performs a bitwise OR operation on the values in the two source registers and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a bitwise OR operation between the value in the source register and the sign-extended immediate value, storing the result in the destination register.
Computes the remainder of the division of the value in the first source register by the value in the second source register (signed). Stores the result in the destination register.
Computes the remainder of the division of the value in the first source register by the value in the second source register (unsigned). Stores the result in the destination register.

Computes the remainder of the division of the lower 32 bits of the first source register by the lower 32 bits of the second source register (unsigned). Stores the result in the destination register, zero-extended to 64 bits.

Computes the remainder of the division of the lower 32 bits of the first source register by the lower 32 bits of the second source register (signed). Stores the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.
Stores the least significant byte (8 bits) of the value in the source register into the memory address computed by adding the offset to the base register.
Stores the least significant double word (64 bits) of the value in the source register into the memory address computed by adding the offset to the base register.
Stores the least significant half word (16 bits) of the value in the source register into the memory address computed by adding the offset to the base register.
Stores the least significant word (32 bits) of the value in the source register into the memory address computed by adding the offset to the base register.

Performs a logical left shift of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a logical left shift of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a logical left shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.

Performs a logical left shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.
Sets the destination register to 1 if the value in the first source register is less than the value in the second source register (signed). Otherwise, sets it to 0.
Sets the destination register to 1 if the value in the source register is less than the immediate value (signed). Otherwise, sets it to 0.
Sets the destination register to 1 if the value in the source register is less than the immediate value (unsigned). Otherwise, sets it to 0.
Sets the destination register to 1 if the value in the first source register is less than the value in the second source register (unsigned). Otherwise, sets it to 0.

Performs an arithmetic right shift of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs an arithmetic right shift of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs an arithmetic right shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.

Performs an arithmetic right shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register, sign-extended to 64 bits.

Performs a logical right shift of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a logical right shift of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a logical right shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the source register by the immediate value and stores the result in the destination register.

Performs a logical right shift of the lower 32 bits of the value in the first source register by the number of bits specified in the lower 5 bits of the second source register and stores the result in the destination register.
Subtracts the value in the second source register from the value in the first source register and stores the result in the destination register.
Subtracts the value in the second source register from the value in the first source register, both treated as 32-bit signed integers, and stores the result in the destination register (32-bit).
Returns from user-level interrupt handler and restores the user-level program counter and status.
Waits for an interrupt to occur. It puts the CPU in a low-power state until an interrupt is received.
Performs a bitwise XOR operation between the values in the two source registers and stores the result in the destination register.
Performs a bitwise XOR operation between the value in the source register and the immediate value, and stores the result in the destination register.

pseudo_instructions.description: Unconditional branch to the target offset.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is equal to zero.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is greater than or equal to zero.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the first source register is greater than the value in the second source register.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the first source register is greater than the value in the second source register (unsigned comparison).
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is greater than zero.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the first source register is less than or equal to the value in the second source register.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the first source register is less than or equal to the value in the second source register (unsigned comparison).
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is less than or equal to zero.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is less than zero.
Branches to the target offset if the value in the source register is not equal to zero.
Performs an unconditional jump to the target address and stores the return address in register x1 (ra).
Clears bits in the CSR (Control and Status Register) specified by src_reg.
Clears bits in the CSR specified by an immediate value.
Reads the value of the specified CSR into a destination register.
Sets bits in the CSR specified by src_reg.
Sets bits in the CSR specified by an immediate value.
Writes the value in src_reg to the specified CSR.
Writes an immediate value to the specified CSR.
